quotes.quote: Dignity consists not in possessing honors, but in the consciousness that we deserve them.
quotes.author: Aristotle

quotes.quote: No race can prosper till it learns that there is as much dignity in tilling a field as in writing a poem.
quotes.author: Booker T. Washington

quotes.quote: Where is there dignity unless there is honesty?
quotes.author: Cicero

quotes.quote: The only kind of dignity which is genuine is that which is not diminished by the indifference of others.
quotes.author: Dag Hammarskjold

quotes.quote: Human Dignity has gleamed only now and then and here and there, in lonely splendor, throughout the ages, a hope of the better men, never an achievement of the majority.
quotes.author: James Thurber

quotes.quote: Be mild with the mild, shrewd with the crafty, confiding to the honest, rough to the ruffian, and a thunderbolt to the liar. But in all this, never be unmindful of your own dignity.
quotes.author: John Brown

quotes.quote: Remember this-that there is a proper dignity and proportion to be observed in the performance of every act of life.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius Antoninus

quotes.quote: One's dignity may be assaulted, vandalized and cruelly mocked, but cannot be taken away unless it is surrendered.
quotes.author: Michael J. Fox

quotes.quote: Dignity and love do not blend well, nor do they continue long together.
quotes.author: Ovid

quotes.quote: Self-respect is the fruit of discipline; the sense of dignity grows with the ability to say no to oneself.
quotes.author: Rabbi Abraham Heschel

quotes.quote: Let not a man guard his dignity, but let his dignity guard him.
quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.quote: Dignity comes not from control, but from understanding who you are and taking your rightful place in the world.
quotes.author: Real Live Preacher

quotes.quote: It is not wealth one asks for, but just enough to preserve one's dignity, to work unhampered, to be generous, frank and independent.
quotes.author: W. Somerset Maugham

quotes.quote: There is a healthful hardiness about real dignity that never dreads contact and communion with others, however humble.
quotes.author: Washington Irving
